Mediation is a good option for resolving disputes when the parties have difficulty communicating or have a poor relationship.`),mdx("h2",null,"Set expectations around the process and agree on ground rules."),mdx("p",null,`To ensure the mediation process is productive, it\u2019s important to set clear expectations and agree on ground rules with the mediator and the disputants. Talk with the mediator ahead of time to determine the number of sessions you\u2019d like to schedule, the length of each session, the location, and any other details that will help the mediation process run smoothly. Then, talk with the disputants to establish ground rules for the mediation session.
Keep in mind that every mediation is different, and the mediator may modify the process as needed to facilitate productive communication between the disputants.`),mdx("h2",null,"Appoint an experienced and effective mediator."),mdx("p",null,`Like any other professional service, mediation is a skill that requires training and experience to master. The mediator acts as a neutral party who helps the parties attempt to resolve their dispute in a fair and equitable manner.
In mediation, both parties together with their respective attorneys choose from various options to settle the case outside of court. The goal of mediation is to find solutions that are agreeable to both parties. It\u2019s about finding win-win solutions instead of win-lose outcomes.
